revised_title: David Whitteridge: A Pioneering Physiologist and Neuroscientist
tldr: David Whitteridge was a distinguished physiologist and neuroscientist who made significant contributions to the understanding of cardiorespiratory control, autonomic nervous system, and the effects of spinal injuries. He pioneered electrophysiological techniques and equipment, and his research on lung afferents and cardiopulmonary receptors provided valuable insights into respiratory distress and heart failure. Whitteridge also collaborated with Ludwig Guttmann to analyze and explain the disturbances of blood pressure and temperature control in paraplegic patients.
